pr_title: feat: DHIS2-10054: Adding new Axis and Legend support for Visualizations

timeline.message:
feat: DHIS2-10054: Adding new Axis and Legend support for Visualizations

This PR adds support for two new JSONB objects in order to support new Visualization requirements regarding Legend and multi-Axis.

timeline.author: larshelge

+import static org.hisp.dhis.common.DxfNamespaces.DXF_2_0;
+
+import java.io.Serializable;
+
+import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
+import com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat.xml.annotation.JacksonXmlProperty;
+
+import lombok.Data;
+
+/**
+ * Represents the respective Visualization axis definition.
+ *
+ * @author maikel arabori
+ */
+@Data
+public class Axis implements Serializable
+{
+
+    @JsonProperty
+    @JacksonXmlProperty( namespace = DXF_2_0 )
+    private Integer index;
+
+    @JsonProperty
+    @JacksonXmlProperty( namespace = DXF_2_0 )
+    private AxisType type;
+
+    @JsonProperty
+    @JacksonXmlProperty( namespace = DXF_2_0 )
+    private StyledObject labels;

replies.bodyText: This is because it relates to the style of all labels the parent object maight have, ie. Legend can have many Labels. So the style applies for all of them. But I can change it to singular if you do prefer.
replies.author: maikelarabori

replies.bodyText:
Actually, this "refact" should not be there, it's a mistake. And yes, I can rename it.
The existing Axis is not being touched nor migrated as part of this task.
This "new" AxisV2 is only used to group the required attributes in the JIRA ticket DHIS2-10054.
replies.author: maikelarabori

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-core into DHIS2-10054
fix: Updating the Flyway script version.
